verses.verse: He that is wounded in the stones<WH6481> <WH1795>, or hath his privy member<WH8212> cut off<WH3772>, shall not enter<WH935> into the congregation<WH6951> of the LORD<WH3068>.

A bastard<WH4464> shall not enter<WH935> into the congregation<WH6951> of the LORD<WH3068>; even to his tenth<WH6224> generation<WH1755> shall he not enter<WH935> into the congregation<WH6951> of the LORD<WH3068>.

An Ammonite<WH5984> or Moabite<WH4125> shall not enter<WH935> into the congregation<WH6951> of the LORD<WH3068>; even to their tenth<WH6224> generation<WH1755> shall they not enter<WH935> into the congregation<WH6951> of the LORD<WH3068> for<WH5704> ever<WH5769>:

Because<WH1697> they met<WH6923> you not with bread<WH3899> and with water<WH4325> in the way<WH1870>, when ye came forth<WH3318> out of Egypt<WH4714>; and because they hired<WH7936> against thee Balaam<WH1109> the son<WH1121> of Beor<WH1160> of Pethor<WH6604> of Mesopotamia<WH763>, to curse<WH7043> thee.

Nevertheless the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> would<WH14> not hearken<WH8085> unto Balaam<WH1109>; but the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> turned<WH2015> the curse<WH7045> into a blessing<WH1293> unto thee, because the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> loved<WH157> thee.
Thou shalt not seek<WH1875> their peace<WH7965> nor their prosperity<WH2896> all thy days<WH3117> for ever<WH5769>. prosperity: Heb. good
Thou shalt not abhor<WH8581> an Edomite<WH130>; for he is thy brother<WH251>: thou shalt not abhor<WH8581> an Egyptian<WH4713>; because thou wast a stranger<WH1616> in his land<WH776>.
The children<WH1121> that are begotten<WH3205> of them shall enter<WH935> into the congregation<WH6951> of the LORD<WH3068> in their third<WH7992> generation<WH1755>.
When the host<WH4264> goeth forth<WH3318> against thine enemies<WH341>, then keep<WH8104> thee from every wicked<WH7451> thing<WH1697>.

If there be among you any man<WH376>, that is not clean<WH2889> by reason of uncleanness that chanceth<WH7137> him by night<WH3915>, then shall he go<WH3318> abroad<WH2351> out of the camp<WH4264>, he shall not come<WH935> within<WH8432> the camp<WH4264>:

But it shall be, when evening<WH6153> cometh on<WH6437>, he shall wash<WH7364> himself with water<WH4325>: and when the sun<WH8121> is down<WH935>, he shall come<WH935> into<WH8432> the camp<WH4264> again. cometh: Heb. turneth toward
Thou shalt have a place also<WH3027> without<WH2351> the camp<WH4264>, whither thou shalt go forth<WH3318> abroad<WH2351>:

And thou shalt have a paddle<WH3489> upon thy weapon<WH240>; and it shall be, when thou wilt ease<WH3427> thyself abroad<WH2351>, thou shalt dig<WH2658> therewith, and shalt turn back<WH7725> and cover<WH3680> that which cometh<WH6627> from thee: wilt: Heb. sittest down

For the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> walketh<WH1980> in the midst<WH7130> of thy camp<WH4264>, to deliver<WH5337> thee, and to give up<WH5414> thine enemies<WH341> before<WH6440> thee; therefore shall thy camp<WH4264> be holy<WH6918>: that he see<WH7200> no unclean<WH6172> thing<WH1697> in thee, and turn away<WH7725> from thee<WH310>. unclean: Heb. nakedness of any thing
Thou shalt not deliver<WH5462> unto his master<WH113> the servant<WH5650> which is escaped<WH5337> from his master<WH113> unto thee:

He shall dwell<WH3427> with thee, even among<WH7130> you, in that place<WH4725> which he shall choose<WH977> in one<WH259> of thy gates<WH8179>, where it liketh him best<WH2896>: thou shalt not oppress<WH3238> him. liketh: Heb. is good for him
There shall be no whore<WH6948> of the daughters<WH1323> of Israel<WH3478>, nor a sodomite<WH6945> of the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>. whore: or, sodomitess

Thou shalt not bring<WH935> the hire<WH868> of a whore<WH2181>, or the price<WH4242> of a dog<WH3611>, into the house<WH1004> of the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> for any vow<WH5088>: for even both<WH8147> these are abomination<WH8441> unto the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430>.
Thou shalt not lend upon usury<WH5391> to thy brother<WH251>; usury<WH5392> of money<WH3701>, usury<WH5392> of victuals<WH400>, usury<WH5392> of any thing<WH1697> that is lent upon usury<WH5391>:

Unto a stranger<WH5237> thou mayest lend upon usury<WH5391>; but unto thy brother<WH251> thou shalt not lend upon usury<WH5391>: that the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> may bless<WH1288> thee in all that thou settest<WH4916> thine hand<WH3027> to in the land<WH776> whither thou goest<WH935> to possess<WH3423> it.

When thou shalt vow<WH5087> a vow<WH5088> unto the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430>, thou shalt not slack<WH309> to pay<WH7999> it: for the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> will surely<WH1875> require<WH1875> it of thee; and it would be sin<WH2399> in thee.
But if thou shalt forbear<WH2308> to vow<WH5087>, it shall be no sin<WH2399> in thee.

That which is gone out<WH4161> of thy lips<WH8193> thou shalt keep<WH8104> and perform<WH6213>; even a freewill offering<WH5071>, according as thou hast vowed<WH5087> unto the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430>, which thou hast promised<WH1696> with thy mouth<WH6310>.

When thou comest<WH935> into thy neighbour's<WH7453> vineyard<WH3754>, then thou mayest eat<WH398> grapes<WH6025> thy fill<WH7648> at thine own pleasure<WH5315>; but thou shalt not put<WH5414> any in thy vessel<WH3627>.

When thou comest<WH935> into the standing corn<WH7054> of thy neighbour<WH7453>, then thou mayest pluck<WH6998> the ears<WH4425> with thine hand<WH3027>; but thou shalt not move<WH5130> a sickle<WH2770> unto thy neighbour's<WH7453> standing corn<WH7054>.
